title: 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving further effect to Regulation
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Designation of
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Designation of 
the Competition and Consumer Protection Commission for Certain Functions) 
Regulations 2025.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited european union (designation competition consumer protection commission certain functions) regulation 2025

title: 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving further effect to Regulation
heading: 2. The European Union (Alternative Dispute Resolution for Consumer
text_raw:
2. The European Union (Alternative Dispute Resolution for Consumer 
Disputes) Regulations 2015 (S.I. No. 343 of 2015) is amended by the substitution 
of the following regulation for regulation 6: 

“6. 

(1) The Commission shall, with regard to disputes arising from 
cross-border sales or service contracts, provide consumers with information 
and assistance to access ADR entities operating in another Member State 
which is competent to deal with a consumer’s cross-border dispute. 

(2) 

The Commission – 

(a) 

shall make the list of ADR entities referred to in Article 20(4) 
of the Directive publicly available by providing a link to the 
relevant European Commission website on its website, and 

(b) 

in so far as is possible, make the list referred to in paragraph 
(a) available on a durable medium at its premises.”.
text_norm: 2 european union (alternative dispute resolution consumer disputes) regulation 2015 (s.i no 343 2015) amended substitution following regulation regulation 6 6 (1) commission shall regard dispute arising cross-border sale service contract provide consumer information assistance access adr entity operating another member state competent deal consumer cross-border dispute (2) commission - (a) shall make list adr entity referred article 20(4) directive publicly available providing link relevant european commission website website (b) far possible make list referred paragraph (a) available durable medium premise

title: 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving further effect to Regulation
heading: 3. The European Union (Online Dispute Resolution for Consumer
text_raw:
3. The European Union (Online Dispute Resolution for Consumer 
Disputes) Regulations 2015 (S.I. No. 500 of 2015) is amended by the substitution 
of the following regulation for regulation 3: 

“3. The Competition and Consumer Protection Commission 
is 
designated as the ODR contact point in the State for the purposes of Article 7

title: 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving further effect to Regulation
heading: 4. The European Union (Unjustified Geoblocking of Consumers)
text_raw:
4. The European Union (Unjustified Geoblocking of Consumers) 
Regulations 2018 (S.I. No. 513 of 2018) is amended by the substitution of the 
following regulation for regulation 4: 

“4. The Competition and Consumer Protection Commission 

is 

designated for the purposes of Article 8 of the Council Regulation.”.
text_norm: 4 european union (unjustified geoblocking consumers) regulation 2018 (s.i no 513 2018) amended substitution following regulation regulation 4 4 competition consumer protection commission designated purpose article 8 council regulation

title: 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving further effect to Regulation
heading: 5. The European Union (Cooperation Between National Authorities
text_raw:
5. The European Union (Cooperation Between National Authorities 
Responsible for the Enforcement of Consumer Protection Laws) Regulations 
2020 (S.I. No. 14 of 2020) is amended by the substitution of the following 
regulation for regulation 6: 

“6. The Commission is designated for the purpose of issuing alerts under 

Article 27 of the Council Regulation.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

6 February, 2025. 

PETER BURKE, 

Minister for Enterprise, Trade and Employment. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [29]

title: 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving further effect to Regulation
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide for the designation of the Competition and Consumer 
Protections Commission (CCPC) for various functions previously assigned to 
the European Consumer Centre Ireland (ECCI). 

The following four Regulations are amended; 

The European Union (Alternative Dispute Resolution for Consumer Disputes) 
Regulations 2015 (S.I. No. 343 of 2015). 

The European Union (Online Dispute Resolution for Consumer Disputes) 
Regulations 2015 (S.I. No. 500 of 2015). 

The European Union (Unjustified Geoblocking of Consumers) Regulations 2018 
(S.I. No. 513 of 2018). 

The European Union (Cooperation Between National Authorities Responsible 
for the Enforcement of Consumer Protection Laws) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 
14 of 2020). 

 
 
 
 
 
 [29] 5
